author: Chip Senkbeil
comment: Worked for the very first day. Then, could never play music again. Tried clearing cache and toggling playback options. No sound and jumps back to beginning of any song after 4 seconds. Tried emailing the developer about the problem, but never heard back.

author: Andrew Heath
comment: Update 11/2017 - This app used to be great over the last few years. Then during the summer it started crashing all the time! I'm listening to music, and then boom, it's gone! Updates haven't fixed it and it continues to crash.  :/  Using the S7.

author: Matt Stephens
comment: I love dsub and use it everyday. the only thing I'd like to see added is a category that has all cached content under it, with the usual options of playing/shuffling/adding to queue. Thanks, amazing app!

Chromecast failed to load errors, using S8, Chromecast Ultra and Android Nougat.  Interface in not very intuitive.  I can connect to my  subsonic server and stream my mp3s though.  I really wanted to stream to chromecast though.  I'm sure SW Dev will eventually fix this.

author: Joe Halpin
comment: Update June 2017: The issue with skipping has been resolved. But now when I try and cast to a Chromecast Audio, I receive a Failed to Load message. This happens on both the S7 and the M8.  ++++++I've been using this app for a while, both on my S7 and now on my M8 that i'm using as a media streamer. On the M8, every now and again songs will skitter and skip. The M8 is wired to my network and my media server has tons of fire power and fast drives (7200+). I have gapless playback turned off and the cache is set to 2000 on an external SD card. Would be nice if this can get resolved.+++++

author: Amo Athwal
comment: Good app, much better than the original subsonic app. Only issue I have is that it will not play with Chromecast Audio, error message is displayed saying 'failed to load'. Would be excellent if fixed.

author: Jim Blaich
comment: The server component is inherently flawed.  After a short but predictable time the server database becomes corrupt.  This process of corruption has been getting worse with each subsequent release of the server. What does this have to do with this app?  Without the server this app is 100% pointless.  Support is also absent.  You can visit the forums but don't expect answers even to common questions such as repeated and predictable database corruption.  There is no solution to the issue and the suggestions only work till the database corrupts again.  Do not use.  Do not buy this app until the author fully addresses the corruption issues.

reply.author: Floss
reply.content: At this point it is a couple of years of "modifying" it and adding features users have asked for.  I'm not looking for the holy grail here, so I'm not sure why you expect it to be innovative.  DSub doesn't do any magic when connecting. I am not sure why you think it is DSubs fault that there is a connection problem from your work.

author: Jay Moore
comment: Latest update has HORRIBLE battery drain on my stock Samsung s8+. Used to be amazing. Still is actually but PLEASE  fix the battery drain.

reply.author: Floss
reply.content: Go into Settings - Casting and turn off DLNA streaming to fix the battery drain

author: Craig Wilhelm
comment: Would love to see more options to customize the app in the notification tray... Only having quick access to pause/play and next is frustrating.

author: David Beltran
comment: App behavior is much better than the Subsonic player. It doesn't mute google maps during navigation and also doesn't restart the song whenever I let the head unit in my car read text messages. While I like the folder and directory structure in the Subsonic app better, I can get used to this. It's worth it if you're using it as an extension of your vehicle's sound system.

author: Sam Taylor
comment: one of the best apps to use for a subsonic server  one small bit of feedback - whilst i love that you can now initiate a rescan of your server from dsub, it would be great if this was confined to the server end and we were not forced to endure an immovable dialogue box giving you updates on the server scan. on my raspberry pi this can take a while.

reply.author: Floss
reply.content: Unfortunately it is not dismissable because on stock Subsonic the server stops working most of the time. Through the API It just returns no albums or artists during the scan.

author: Chris Melton
comment: Still the best app ever made.  There haven't any updates lately, are you still supporting it?  Thank you.

author: J. S.
comment: I like the app, it is a bit clunky, but still the best of all available alternatives. I really, really wish the remote play on the server would be just a toggle and not show the album art, I am looking at in the player anyway. Keep the double check when turning on though, since I dont want to give anyone at home a heart attack :)

author: Jeremy MJ
comment: Doesn't work yet, waiting for support. Web browser has no issues, but the mobile app has connectivity issues.

author: Ian Kirby
comment: The app is good generally, i use it with android auto and have no problems with streaming However on both my previous phone (nexus 6p on oreo ) and my new pixel 2 (also oreo) it occasionally eats battery, this is unpredictable and may jot happen for a week or so .then suddenly i notice a low battery and find that 29% of usage is dsub  I hope this can be fixed because I love the app

author: Digi De
comment: Hi, everytime I pay a track it downloads to my stock music player. How can I stop DSub from doing this action? Your input would be greatly appreciated. I only want to download tracks I choose, not every track I stream.... please help.

reply.author: Floss
reply.content: There is an option under Settings - Cache/Network at the bottom to hide music downloaded by DSub from other music players.

author: Lars van Lenteren
comment: finally, a subsonic streaming app that knows how to handle audio ducking and remembers where (somewhere in the middle of some song) i left off last time!

author: Matthew Oliver
comment: Since updating to Nougat a few days ago my phone has started overheating. Only happens when using this app.

author: Phil Yewdall
comment: It's been great until recently when it started eating up my battery worse than any other app I've experienced, even when I'm not using it.

author: Boris Strelchin
comment: Running on my new OnePlus 5 phone, this app absolutely refused to connect to my server. When I switch the SIM card into my old phone (HTC 10), it works without issue.
Android auto won't stream, but streams via mobile app ok... Broken??? Is development dead....

author: Patrick Burns
comment: Sends hundreds of screen wakelocks on Oreo. Took me forever to figure out it was DSub causing my phone not to sleep.

author: Justin Cramer
comment: Feature wise it's great, however I have to delete it from my devices to keep it from killing my battery. Chews battery every 3 hours even if I don't start it up all since last boot.

author: Fabio Endrich
comment: Since the last update the app crashes 5sec after every start

author: Lars Archenholtz
comment: Förutom att smidigt streama hemifrån till mobilen när jag är ute så kan man, när man är hemma, välja att spela upp på servern/datorn (även utan Chromecast!). Då fungerar appen som en mycket kapabel/finessrik fjärrkontroll.

author: Wave rider
comment: Great works well with my madsonic docker. My own music library set out just how i like it. Has work great on my lg g6. Lots of customisation.

author: Marek Michalík
comment: Stops working on oreo, mate 10 pro, plays double speed, or not at all.

author: Caleb Bahler
comment: Feature request.... A background process in the app that would periodically ping the server, and a green light in the UI that would let user know server is reachable

reply.author: Floss
reply.content: According to the Developer Console: "You've made all purchases of your app available for Family Library".  If it's still not working for you I don't think there is anything I can do on my end.

comment: I love this app with my subsonic server!!!! Best one out there!!

author: Fawaz Al-Rushaid
comment: Please make id3v2 lyrics gets cached as well with the mp3 files.

author: Charlie Chaney
comment: Needs to fix battery usage. Otherwise very useful

author: Michael Knuckles
comment: This is a really great app, the shuffle que works much better than the alternative apps.
Can you make it so we can star items from the podcast screen?

author: Doug
comment: Great app. Go on off a star because of lack of Google home/OK Google integration

author: jason dunn
comment: Exactly what I am looking for!

author: Clark Wright
comment: Up until I updated my Nexus 6p to Android6 7, this app was perfect.   Since then,  it is the single largest battery consumer.   As an example,  overnight it drained 30% of the battery simply being resident in memory.   On the other hand,  it doesn't drain any faster while in use,  so you just need to remember to force stop the app.                       ....                                            As of the 11/29/16 update,   not enabling dlna does appear to fix the battery issue.

reply.author: Floss
reply.content: You should be able to update to get a fix now

title: Great app,  responsive developer

author: Sven Moelter
comment: a few things are annoying. 1) Why even have an online/offline mode, why isn't there just a check if a network link is up? Doesn't Android have that capability? I allways have to remember to switch back to online mode, or the sync won't work and the UI works differently depending on which mode i'm currently in. 2) Why does the creation of a random playlist in offline-mode sometimes take >1 min. when it is instant in online-mode, whether i'm actually online or not?
title: I like it, but...

author: Christian Williams
comment: Fantastic app that is consistently updated that I have used forever with Subsonic.  A recent bug I have discovered relates to Chromecast usage and switching back to normal (local/online) use.  After stopping Chromecasting, the app will sometimes give a "failed to load" error when playing content normally until I force stop the app.  I have duplicated this issue on 3 different devices (Nexus5, S7, OnePlus3T).  Keep up the great work!  Edit: disabling DLNA resolved the issue.  May want to disable by default.  Thanks again!

reply.author: Floss
reply.content: I will take a look at it

author: Karl Zlotnicki
comment: Always works great for music and podcasts. Shuffle doesn't shuffle the entire offline library, rather makes a 30 or so song playlist that eventually loops. That is a little annoying.   Also wish chromecasting videos worked.

author: Nick Alvarado
comment: Great app. However on 5.3.4 I'm getting stuttering when my screen is off. I'm attempting to diagnose this as 5.3.2 did not give me this issue. For the time being I'll be flipping back to the older version. I'm on PureNexus 7.1, rooted with viper4arise.
title: Great app!
